Title: Axel Holm to John Holm 1946.12.11
Description: LETTER FROM AXEL HOLM DATED DECEMBER 11-1946 TO JOHN.  NO ENVELOPE.
Creator: Axel Holm
Siri Lawson, trans.
Text:
Thank you for the letter I received yesterday, and which you had written on Dec. 3.

Thank you for the book mark you inclosed, and for what you will continue to send us.  If it suits you I think Einar is in need of all kinds of things, as they are just now starting out in life.  Everything is as usual  Eilif turns 37 years old tomorrow.  today I’m going to bike to Hegre to visit mother.  I ought to have a car that could go 10 miles an hour.  I’m sending you a Christmas magazine  there was a piece in it about Enok Berg whom you knew I would think.

So thank you for everything, and once again have a blessed Christmas and Happy New Year.

Axel

You remember the priest Rode don’t you.

I’m sending you some Christmas cards so that you in your old age can see a glimpse of old Norway.

Ax.

What year did you go to America and how old were you  what was the name of your first wife and where was she from  where is she from (born) the one you have now, when did Olaf die?  Anna?

That was many questions.

Ax.

I’m looking after Helge today  Astrid and Einar are in Trondheim, he makes a terrible mess.

Ax.
